Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rev. Canon L. Franklin Reid, Rector, St. Luke's Episcopal Church, 777 East 222nd Street, Bronx, New York   10466.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Seabrook.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Canon L. Franklin Reid, Rector, St. Luke's Episcopal Church, 777 East 222nd Street, The Bronx, N.Y. 10466.  

Council Member Seabrook moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter and Section 62-722(a) of the Zoning Resolution, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 030412 MMK, an amendment to the City Map; C 030414 ZSK, a special permit;  C 030415 ZSK, a special permit and N 030416 ZAK, an authorization, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 030413 ZMK that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, IKEA Red Hook, Brooklyn (C030412MMK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Moskowitz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 696 Madison Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 4, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20045643 TCM.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk cafe, 696 Madison Ave, Manhattan (20045643TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Moskowitz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 25 East 63rd Street, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 4, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20055061 TCM.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Café, 23 East 65th Street, Manhattan, CD#4 (20055061TCM)

Items.Title: General Order Calendar
Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the ownership and operation by local electric corporations of any piece of electrical-related infrastructure in the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: All entities, engaged in the provision of electrical service to conduct annual equipment inspections, repairs and reports to the council regarding the status of such inspections and repairs.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution declaring the month of October as National Disability Employment Awareness Month in New York City
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: National Disability Employment Awareness Month, October

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the Mayor and any elected official from using the Police Department to limit dissemination of political speech and from employing the political process, or political influence inherent with the elective office, for the purpose of silencing political dissent.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting silencing political dissent.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to the creation of an annual report to assess the city’s indigent legal representation.
Items.MatterName: Creation of an annual report to assess the city’s indigent legal representation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating disclosure requirements related to mobile telephone service.
Items.MatterName: Creating disclosure requirements related to mobile telephone service.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the automobile industry to stop enticing consumers to purchase a new car while still paying a remaining balance on an old car loan that exceeds the old car’s trade-in value.
Items.MatterName: Auto industry to stop enticing consumers to purchase a new car while still paying a remaining balance on an old car.

Items.Title: Resolution urging New York State to allow persons who are in dating relationships and experience abuse to petition for orders of protection in Family Court.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues due back on 9/29/2004.
Items.MatterName: Allow persons who are in dating relationships and experience abuse to petition for orders of protection in Family Court.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing a juvenile curfew.
Items.MatterName: Imposing a juvenile curfew.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on New York city’s purchase and use of wood and recycled plastic lumber.
Items.MatterName: Reporting on NYC’s purchase and use of wood and recycled plastic lumber.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating elder care information centers where persons can receive information on programs and services pertinent to senior citizens.
Items.MatterName: Creating elder care information centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale of sharpened samurai swords or other large swords of a similar kind.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of sharpened samurai swords or other large swords of a similar kind.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to posting beach inspection results, and to repeal section 18-131 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as enacted by local law number 14 for the year 1991.
Items.MatterName: Posting clean beach standards and inspection results.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a database to track vehicle-related accidents and violations of traffic control signals, installing signs at the fifty locations with the highest number of vehicle-related accidents and installing traffic control signal photo monitoring systems at the fifty locations with the highest number of summonses or notices issued for violations of traffic control signals in the city.
Items.MatterName: Create a database to track vehicle-related accidents.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of New York City to promote greater health equity in the City.
Items.MatterName: Mayor of New York City to promote greater health equity in the City.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting S. 1510 and H.R. 832, the Permanent Partners Immigration Act of 2003, which would amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow United States citizens and permanent residents to sponsor their permanent partners for legal residence in the United States.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Immigration and Nationality Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State to pass a law requiring that schools provide instruction on domestic violence and sexual assault in grades 7-12.
Items.MatterName: Requiring that schools provide instruction on domestic violence and sexual assault in grades 7-12.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of language assistance services by the Department of Education.
Items.MatterName: Provision of language assistance services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the protection of domestic animals from injuries inflicted by dangerous dogs.
Items.MatterName: Protection of domestic animals from injuries inflicted by dangerous dogs.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing October 12-20, 2004 as National Bone and Joint Decade Awareness Week, and encouraging the promotion of education and greater awareness of Fibrodysplasia Ossificans Progressiva in the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health due back on 9/29/2004.
Items.MatterName: National Bone and Joint Decade Awareness Week - October 12-20, 2004

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to application of the public disclosure requirements of the New York City Campaign Finance Program to all candidates for the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council.
Items.MatterName: Application of selected requirements of the NYC Campaign Finance Program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections.
Items.MatterName: Requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring employers in the grocery industry to make prevailing health care expenditures on behalf of their employees.
Items.MatterName: Assessing a fee in certain service industries in order to establish a city program to provide health care for workers.

Items.Title: Resolution ratifying the memorandum of understanding entered into pursuant to chapter 175 of the laws of 2003 in connection with the Croton water filtration facility and the funding of certain eligible projects in the borough of the Bronx.
Items.MatterName: Croton water filtration facility and the funding of certain eligible projects in the borough of the Bronx.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law to require national background checks and fingerprinting of all applicants to drive limousines, for-hire cars and taxicabs licensed by the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission.
Items.MatterName: Vehicle and Traffic Law to require national background check and fingerprinting of all applicants to drive limousine, for-hire cars and taxicab.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the granting of an exemption from real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the real property tax law, for the parcel owned by Congregation Avnei Pinchos known as 5822 17th Avenue in the City of New York, borough of Brooklyn, being designated on the tax map as block 5503, lot 52 and 53 in such borough, and the cancellation of taxes, fines, penalties and interest remaining unpaid, and the making of appropriate correction of the subject assessment roll, if, upon accepting and reviewing the application or renewal application for such exemption, the Department of Finance is satisfied that such corporation or association would otherwise be entitled to such exemption if it had filed such application for exemption by the appropriate taxable status date, in accordance with Chapter 326 of the laws of 2003.
Items.MatterName: Approving the granting of an exemption from real property taxes, Congregation Avnei Pinchos known as 5822 17th St, NY.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to assault weapons.
Items.MatterName: Assault Weapons

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to amend the Penal Law to include the denial of a weapons permit for any applicant convicted of violating New York City’s assault weapons ban.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Penal Law to include the denial of a weapons permit for any applicant convicted of violating NYC’s assault weapons ban.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following announcements

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, October 13, 2004.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motions which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
